One of the Emblems who were summoned to
Elyos. Resides in the Ring of the Lady of the
Plains. Appears in Fire Emblem: The Blazing
Blade / Fire Emblem Engage.
Can attack foes six spaces away three\ntimes by changing Style! Her engaged\nally can also attack five spaces away.

$aAccelerates Special trigger (cooldown count-1).
Effective against flying foes.

At start of turn, if unit is within 2 spaces of an
ally, grants Atk/Spd+6,【Desperation】, and
【Preempt Pulse】to unit and allies within
2 spaces of unit for 1 turn.

If unit is within 3 spaces of an ally, grants
bonus to unit's Atk/Spd = 6 + 20% of unit's
Spd at start of combat, deals +7 damage
(excluding area-of-effect Specials), and
reduces the percentage of foe's non-Special
"reduce damage by X%" skills by 50% during
combat (excluding area-of-effect Specials),
and also, if decreasing the Spd difference
necessary to make a follow-up attack by 25
would allow unit to trigger a follow-up attack
(excluding guaranteed or prevented
follow-ups), triggers【Potent Follow X%】
during combat (if unit cannot perform
follow-up and attack twice, X = 80; otherwise,
X = 40).

【Desperation】
Grants the following effect for 1 turn: "If unit
initiates combat, unit can make a follow-up
attack before foe can counterattack."

【Preempt Pulse】
Grants Special cooldown count-1 to unit
before unit's first attack during combat.

【Potent Follow X%】
Triggers an additional follow-up attack
immediately after unit's standard follow-up
attack and deals damage = X% of unit's normal
attack damage (if unit cannot make a follow-up
attack, this effect triggers when the standard
follow-up attack would occur; this effect is
treated like a follow-up attack, so effects like
"reduce damage by X%" still apply, but this
effect is not affected by effects that prevent
follow-ups or "attacks twice" effects; only
highest value applied; does not stack).

$aAccelerates Special trigger (cooldown count-1).
Effective against flying foes.

At start of turn, if unit is within 2 spaces of an
ally, grants Atk/Spd+6,【Desperation】, and
【Preempt Pulse】to unit and allies within
2 spaces of unit for 1 turn.

If unit is within 3 spaces of an ally, grants
bonus to unit's Atk/Spd = 6 + 20% of unit's
Spd at start of combat, deals +7 damage
(excluding area-of-effect Specials), and
reduces the percentage of foe's non-Special
"reduce damage by X%" skills by 50% during
combat (excluding area-of-effect Specials),
and also, if decreasing the Spd difference
necessary to make a follow-up attack by 25
would allow unit to trigger a follow-up attack
(excluding guaranteed or prevented
follow-ups), triggers【Potent Follow X%】
during combat (if unit cannot perform
follow-up and attack twice, X = 80; otherwise,
X = 40).

$aBoosts damage by 40% of unit's Spd when
Special triggers.

If unit's Special is ready or has triggered
during this combat,【Potent Follow X%】
has triggered, and X ≤ 99, then X = 100.

Unit can use the following【Style】:
――――― Astra Storm Style ―――――
Unit can attack foes within 6 spaces of unit
and 3 rows or 3 columns centered on unit
regardless of unit's range. Unit suffers
a counterattack if any of the following
conditions are met: foe is armored with
Range = 2, foe can counterattack regardless
of unit's range, or foe's Range is the same as
the distance between unit and foe.

Unit cannot move or attack structures,
after-combat movement effects do not occur,
and remaining movement granted from Canto
is treated as 0. Skill effect's Range is treated
as 2, including by skill effects determined by
attack Range, like Pavise and Aegis. This Style
can be used only once per turn.
――――――――――――――――――――

【Potent Follow X%】
Triggers an additional follow-up attack
immediately after unit's standard follow-up
attack and deals damage = X% of unit's normal
attack damage (if unit cannot make a follow-up
attack, this effect triggers when the standard
follow-up attack would occur; this effect is
treated like a follow-up attack, so effects like
"reduce damage by X%" still apply, but this
effect is not affected by effects that prevent
follow-ups or "attacks twice" effects; only
highest value applied; does not stack).

【Style】
Change Style using the Style button at the
bottom of the screen.

A unit's Style is only active when that unit
is taking an action. When unit has a status or a
skill that enables use of a Style, Duo Skills and
Harmonized Skills cannot be used while unit
can take an action (those skills can be used
after unit has acted).
Style use is disabled when unit is deployed
using Pair Up or when unit is equipped with
multiple skills that have a Style.

$aBoosts damage by 40% of unit's Spd when
Special triggers.

during this combat,【Potent Follow X%】
has triggered, and X ≤ 99, then X = 100.

a counterattack if any of the following
conditions are met: foe is armored with
Range = 2, foe can counterattack regardless

Unit cannot move or attack structures,
after-combat movement effects do not occur,
and remaining movement granted from Canto
is treated as 0. Skill effect's Range is treated
as 2, including by skill effects determined by
attack Range, like Pavise and Aegis. This Style
can be used only once per turn.
――――――――――――――――――――

$aAt start of turn, grants Spd【Great Talent】+1
to unit.

After combat, if unit attacked, grants
Spd【Great Talent】+1 to unit.

Deals damage = 5% of unit's Spd during
combat (excluding area-of-effect Specials).

(This skill grants max of【Great Talent】+5.)

【Great Talent】
Adds value of Great Talent (+X) to specified
stats (until end of battle; max value of X is
determined by the stat reaching the limit of 99,
each stat calculated separately and cannot
exceed max value for each skill; stat increases
are not treated as Bonus effects).

to unit.

After combat, if unit attacked, grants
Spd【Great Talent】+3 to unit.

Deals damage = 15% of unit's Spd during

(This skill grants max of【Great Talent】+15.)

【Great Talent】
Adds value of Great Talent (+X) to specified
stats (until end of battle; max value of X is

After combat, if unit attacked, grants

$aAt start of turn, grants Spd【Great Talent】+1
to unit.

After combat, if unit attacked, grants
Spd【Great Talent】+4 to unit.

Inflicts Spd/Def-4 on foe, unit deals damage =
20% of unit's Spd (excluding area-of-effect
Specials), neutralizes unit's penalties to Spd,
and neutralizes effects that inflict "Special
cooldown charge -X" on unit during combat.

(This skill grants max of【Great Talent】+20.)

【Great Talent】
Adds value of Great Talent (+X) to specified
stats (until end of battle; max value of X is
determined by the stat reaching the limit of 99,
each stat calculated separately and cannot
exceed max value for each skill; stat increases
are not treated as Bonus effects).

$aAt start of turn, grants Spd【Great Talent】+1
to unit.

After combat, if unit attacked, grants
Spd【Great Talent】+4 to unit.

Inflicts Spd/Def-4 on foe, unit deals damage =
20% of unit's Spd (excluding area-of-effect
Specials), neutralizes unit's penalties to Spd,

(This skill grants max of【Great Talent】+20.)

$aWhen Special triggers, boosts damage by unit's
max Special cooldown count value × 4
(excluding area-of-effect Specials).

Unit can use the following【Style】:
――――― Emblem Lyn Style ―――――
Unit can attack foes within 5 spaces of unit
and 3 rows or 3 columns centered on unit
regardless of unit's range. Unit suffers
a counterattack if any of the following
conditions are met: foe is armored with
Range = 2, foe can counterattack regardless
of unit's range, foe's Range is the same as the
distance between unit and the foe.

Unit cannot move or attack structures,
after-combat movement effects do not occur,
unit's area-of-effect Specials cannot be
triggered, and remaining movement granted
from Canto is treated as 0. Skill effect's Range
is treated as 2, including by skill effects
determined by attack Range, like Pavise and
Aegis. This Style can be used only when unit's
Range = 2, cannot be used on the first turn,
and once used, cannot be used for two turns.
――――――――――――――――――――

【Style】
Change Style using the Style button at the
bottom of the screen.

A unit's Style is only active when that unit
is taking an action. When unit has a status or a
skill that enables use of a Style, Duo Skills and
Harmonized Skills cannot be used while unit
can take an action (those skills can be used
after unit has acted).
Style use is disabled when unit is deployed
using Pair Up or when unit is equipped with
multiple skills that have a Style.

$aWhen Special triggers, boosts damage by unit's

(excluding area-of-effect Specials).

――――― Emblem Lyn Style ―――――

conditions are met: foe is armored with
Range = 2, foe can counterattack regardless

Unit cannot move or attack structures,
after-combat movement effects do not occur,
unit's area-of-effect Specials cannot be
triggered, and remaining movement granted
from Canto is treated as 0. Skill effect's Range
is treated as 2, including by skill effects
determined by attack Range, like Pavise and
Aegis. This Style can be used only when unit's
Range = 2, cannot be used on the first turn,
and once used, cannot be used for two turns.
――――――――――――――――――――
The Imperial army of $Iw2|, $Iw11|, and $Iw1| awaits!

Three powers vie for control of
Fódlan, a land under the watchful eye
of a goddess. At its center sits Garreg
Mach Monastery, where the Imperial
princess, the crown prince, and the
future Alliance leader study together
under the guidance of the archbishop
of the Church of Seiros...

In an act of rebellion, the Western
Church then attacks the monastery.
The aggressing force is led by the
masked Death Knight, and though
their assault ultimately fails, he does
manage to capture two students.
Tracking them in hopes of rescuing
the students, Byleth encounters yet
another masked enemy, the Flame
Emperor, who appears and prevents
any further exchange...

While responding to a shocking crisis
in Remire Village where inhabitants
were slaughtering each other, Byleth
and his students again discover the
Death Knight among the chaos. In
witness to the tragic scene, the Flame
Emperor offers an alliance to Byleth.
Upon Byleth's refusal, the Flame
Emperor warns Byleth this will be a
regretful decision and then slips
away...

Upon receiving a report that Demonic
Beasts have appeared, Byleth and
Jeralt rush to intervene. Jeralt is
moved by his son's courage, but soon
falls victim to the blade of an assassin
who had been masquerading as a
student. A tearful Byleth holds him in
his arms as he dies.

Byleth chases his father's killer to
the Sealed Forest, where entry is
ordinarily restricted. After being
ensnared in the trap that his enemies
set for him, Byleth becomes one with
the goddess and is born anew. As a
result, he is bid to enter the Holy
Tomb to receive enlightenment, but
he is followed shortly by the Flame
Emperor, troops in tow...

The Flame Emperor is then
revealed to be Edelgard, house
leader of the Black Eagles and
newly crowned emperor of the
Adrestian Empire. Forced to retreat
to imperial territory, Edelgard boldly
declares war on the Church of Seiros,
and Byleth is forced to choose
between Edelgard and the remaining
students defending the monastery.
